subject: See You In Fargo
event:
I am off tomorrow to Fargo, North Dakota for Valleycon.  I hope to see some of you there.  I gather there may be some BWBers on hand, Jim Ludwig of Dark Sword Miniatures will be turning up with some of his fabulous Ice & Fire range, and I'll be reading a chapter from A DANCE WITH DRAGONS.  Plus there will be the usual drinking and carousing and fine dining, one hopes.

I will, alas, miss this weekend's football games, so don't expect any NFL posts on Sunday night or Monday morning.  And please don't post yourself about the games.  My faithful friend TiVo will be recording the games for me, and I want to watch them unspoiled when I return on Monday night.

After Fargo, I have two days at home, and then I'm off again on a much longer trip, to visit the set of the HBO pilot shoot, and do those signings in Belfast and Dublin.  Oh, and it looks like a third event is in the works, for London.  I will let you know the details when they are set.

After England, Morocco.  That should be fun.  Never been there, and though I am pretty well travelled for a kid from Bayonne, Marrakech sounds considerably more exotic than any place that I have ever been before.  

Things will probably get pretty quiet here while I'm away.  I don't travel with a laptop, so I expect I won't be posting much... though I may pop in once in a while from a hotel business center, when I stumble on one.

And yes, TiVo will be getting all those games for me as well.  I expect to be immersing myself in a month of Jets and Giants games along about Thanksgiving.

Till then... take care, all.  Hang loose, sundry.

comments.article: Good luck, have fun, be safe and we'll see you when you return!
Be safe.  And get over here to Jersey!!  Ya got fans here who want ta see ya!!  Bing!
It would be lovely if there was someone on the set who would blog about it a bit.  Do you know of anyone who might do so?
Have a great convention, and happy travelling!

comments.upictitle: Some Guy Named Paul's Comix: Group
comments.article: Have fun, travel safe, and please say hi to the good people on the show from all your fans!

Hope you have a great time here in Fargo.  Looks like Sat. and Sun might turn out to be decent weather.  I stick by my previous comments about dressing warm, though.  Here in the north, winter is coming... ;)
Eat LOTS of Moroccan food.  It is divine.
But be careful where you eat that food. The only time I went to Marakesh I got the runs something awful.

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: furries
comments.article: I hope you and Parris have a great time over the next month and a trouble-free trip!
Looking forward to having you up in Fargo. Unfortunately, we may have a bit of snow for you :(

Wow. Bummer of timing on the trips. I mean How will Ireland and Morocco stack up to the splendor that is Fargo. Oh well, You'll just have to make the best of it I guess.

See you at Valley Con!

Marrakesh can be just about anything you want it to be - from full force, in your face encounter with North Africa, to sequestered luxury. If that England trip should stretch north to Scotland, I'll be sure to ply you with traveler's tales - or if you don't mind unsolicited advice, I'll send you some through this new-fangled email thing.

Were I on your schedule, I might consider going directly on to England from Fargo (via MSP or Chicago, or possibly via somewhere in Canada). Going home for just two days sounds exhausting! But no doubt you have reasons to do it this way.

Just don't re-read Tom Disch's "Casablanca" before going to Morocco.
Have a great trip! :) See you on the flip side.

Hi!

I'm new to your Journal.
I just wanted to say I positively adore your writing!

Have a great time in Fargo!

comments.upictitle: irishkate: need coffee tired depressed ill
comments.article: looking forward to seeing you in Dublin...

Good luck avoiding all comments about the NO-NY game. It's the game of the week and probably going to be subject to casual conversation. You may have to run around with your fingers in your ears going "lalalala."

Aside from that, have a fun trip!
Looking forward to it - ValleyCon is one of my favorite weekends every year, and this will just make it better.

There was some talk of snow - bring a jacket. :(

See you in Fargo. :)
We're getting some snow flurries right now. :)  Probably won't stick around too long, though.

Damn it! I just left England and moved to Japan. If only you'd gone to London a month earlier I would have traveled up to London to see you. Any chance you'll ever come to Japan?

Anyway have a safe trip, and enjoy the carousing and fine dining. You're a busy man, so you deserve it. I don't know how you fit it all in!
きおつけて！

Wow I can't imagine missing the Saints/Giants game!! Good luck getting to see it unspoiled.

Morocco is beautiful and an awesome trip... lucky you!
Have an amazing trip, you're travelling to far-off places to see your own world come to life. Enjoy it.

Marrakesh is one of the coolest places on earth. Fire-eaters and stork-infested castles and old nominally Muslim dudes that tell fortunes with tortoise shells -- how can you go wrong? The city also has some of the prettiest sounding prayer-callers in all the Islamic world. If you get a chance, check out a rooftop garden at sunset.

Damn, I'm getting all nostalgic over here...

Is your suitcase big enough for a passenger?  Ahh, I know the logistics (damn airport/airline rules) won't allow any fun like that.  So, guess you and Parris are stuck with the dirty deed of having fun for us all!  Now that's ALOT of pressure... lol!!!  Enjoy!

Have safe trips and lots of fun!

You won't be so far away... when are you stopping by France? ;)

We'll be good kids and wait patiently your return XD

Dear George,

1. Safe travels
2. Have lots of fun in Morocco, it is a wonderful, colourful country. Do not miss an opportunity to visit the mountains, it is where the richness of the country hides. And eat lots of Moroccan food, it is delicious (keep a soda nearby though, cause its quiet heavy).
3. Pretty please ask someone in production to blog about the shootings. You won't be able to keep us updated daily, so please get someone to do it for us. We are dying to get information, as I am certain, you are quiet aware of by now.
4. Get a lot of pictures for us from all your travels.

Best regards,
Your extended "family"!!
